hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Cliff Edge Detection Before Bear Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: When NEUTRAL regime shows deteriorating liquidity (bid-ask spread widening + depth reduction) while price remains range-bound, this predicts transition to BEAR regime within 3-5 days with 70%+ accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers and liquidity providers withdraw during deteriorating conditions before price reflects the change. This liquidity cliff serves as leading indicator of regime deterioration, as participants reduce exposure ahead of perceived risk.
entry_conditions: Order book depth at ±2% reduces >15% over 24H

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confirmed by 2 consecutive 4H regime classifications)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Liquidity metrics recover to 24H prior levels OR price breaks range to upside >3%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days after entry if no regime transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Liquidity deterioration occurs but price breaks upward out of range with follow-through, OR regime transitions to BULL instead of BEAR
